title: Bug: issue descriptions with code blocks get corrupted
description:
## Bug Description

When creating an issue with `jit issue create --description` containing code blocks with commands/JSON, the description gets corrupted with actual command output embedded in it.

## Steps to Reproduce

1. Create an issue with description containing backtick-quoted commands like:
   - `jit issue update 9112af40 --state done --json`
   - JSON code blocks with issue data
2. The resulting issue description has actual command output inserted
3. Updating the description with `jit issue update --description` shows the same corruption

## Example

Attempted to create issue f0b27778 with proper markdown description containing:
- Code blocks with example commands
- JSON examples
- Structured sections

Result: Description filled with actual `jit issue show` output instead of the markdown text.

## Expected Behavior

- Issue description stored exactly as provided
- Code blocks treated as literal text, not executed
- No command substitution or interpretation

## Actual Behavior

- Commands in backticks appear to be executed or substituted
- JSON examples get replaced with actual issue data
- Description becomes unreadable

## Workaround

Use simple descriptions without code blocks or complex markdown. Tested creating issue b6aeb05b with simple text - worked correctly.

## Impact

- Cannot document bugs with reproduction steps containing commands
- Cannot include JSON examples in issue descriptions
- Limits usefulness of issue descriptions for technical bugs

## Acceptance Criteria

- Issue descriptions with code blocks preserved exactly
- Backtick-quoted text not interpreted as commands
- JSON code blocks stored as literal text
- Test coverage for markdown in descriptions
